text: Hi - is it possible to do redirects for items in the file manager?
you have to do then relative to the site domain
Ok,  I tried with  /hubfs/my-folder/my-file.pdf, but i got an error saying hubfs is reserved
the file cant exist at the old url
It doesn’t - i moved it within file manager
hmm. I know i have done this before.
Thank you for answering Zack - I probably mis-read this but I saw it here: <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/forms/use-non-HubSpot-forms>
"Please note: all data submitted to non-HubSpot form fields will only match to single-line text field type properties in HubSpot. Non-HubSpot form fields cannot match with other field types."

Ah ok, so that’s a specific feature where the HubSpot tracking code attempts to automatically detect forms on a page and send the data to HubSpot without you doing anything.  If you are using HubSpot forms and embedding them in your pages you can use all the field types we support.
I just tried adding it to a drag and drop and did some clicking and clacking but could not find a way to change it. Maybe it was removed.
Since you need a modal window this might help inspire you <https://codepen.io/JacobLett/pen/mddOdmx>
